page.title: 08Chapel House
page.content: Grade II listed, traditional brick built cottage; onetime farmhouse (built sideways on to the road). Front part of house c.1800, back c.1820 and definately prior to 1840. Present owners: Mr & Mrs Ruff. Purchased in original state (including tiled floors, ranges, pork curing room no bathroom or toilet) in April 1984. Sale was possible after the death of the tenant Jim Collishaw (bachelor, one-time famous "scytheman") in Feb. 1983 at 82 years. He had lived there since at least 1941 at a peppercorn rent of 7s.6d (37\p) fixed by agree- ment. No proper repairs or alterations had been affected in this time. The tenants from 1908-1926 worked for the Duke of Portland. Remains of a washhouse were found next to the house and a dry well in the garden.
